items.title: Fake "Security Alert" issues on GitHub use OAuth app to hijack accounts
items.author: Lawrence Abrams
items.content: <article>A widespread phishing campaign has targeted nearly 12,000 GitHub repositories with fake "Security Alert" issues, tricking developers into authorizing a malicious OAuth app that grants attackers full control over their accounts and code. [...]</article>

items.title: Malicious Adobe, DocuSign OAuth apps target Microsoft 365 accounts
items.author: Bill Toulas
items.content: <article>Cybercriminals are promoting malicious Microsoft OAuth apps that masquerade as Adobe and DocuSign apps to deliver malware and steal Microsoft 365 accounts credentials. [...]</article>

items.title: New Akira ransomware decryptor cracks encryptions keys using GPUs
items.author: Bill Toulas
items.content: <article>Security researcher Yohanes Nugroho has released a decryptor for the Linux variant of Akira ransomware, which utilizes GPU power to retrieve the decryption key and unlock files for free. [...]</article>

items.title: Coinbase phishing email tricks users with fake wallet migration
items.author: Lawrence Abrams
items.content: <article>A large-scale Coinbase phishing attack poses as a mandatory wallet migration, tricking recipients into setting up a new wallet with a pre-generated recovery phrase controlled by attackers. [...]</article>

items.title: Week-long Exchange Online outage causes email failures, delays
items.author: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: <article>Microsoft says it partially mitigated a week-long Exchange Online outage causing delays or failures when sending or receiving email messages. [...]</article>

items.title: Ransomware gang creates tool to automate VPN brute-force attacks
items.author: Bill Toulas
items.content: <article>The Black Basta ransomware operation created an automated brute-forcing framework dubbed 'BRUTED' to breach edge networking devices like firewalls and VPNs. [...]</article>

items.title: Cisco IOS XR vulnerability lets attackers crash BGP on routers
items.author: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: <article>Cisco has patched a denial of service (DoS) vulnerability that lets attackers crash the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) process on IOS XR routers with a single BGP update message. [...]</article>

items.title: Suspected LockBit ransomware dev extradited to United States
items.author: Bill Toulas
items.content: <article>A dual Russian-Israeli national, suspected of being a key developer for the LockBit ransomware operation, has been extradited to the United States to face charges. [...]</article>

items.title: Microsoft apologizes for removing VSCode extensions used by millions
items.author: Bill Toulas
items.content: <article>Microsoft has reinstated the 'Material Theme - Free' and 'Material Theme Icons - Free' extensions on the Visual Studio Marketplace after finding that the obfuscated code they contained wasn't actually malicious. [...]</article>

items.title: New SuperBlack ransomware exploits Fortinet auth bypass flaws
items.author: Bill Toulas
items.content: <article>A new ransomware operator named 'Mora_001' is exploiting two Fortinet vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access to firewall appliances and deploy a custom ransomware strain dubbed SuperBlack. [...]</article>

items.title: Windows Notepad to get AI text summarization in Windows 11
items.author: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: <article>Microsoft is now testing an AI-powered text summarization feature in Notepad and a Snipping Tool "Draw & Hold" feature that helps draw perfect shapes. [...]</article>

items.title: Microsoft says button to restore classic Outlook is broken
items.author: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: <article>â€‹Microsoft is investigating a known issue that causes the new Outlook email client to crash when users click the "Go to classic Outlook" button, which should help them switch back to the classic Outlook. [...]</article>
